def main():
    """Convert all markdown files to HTML."""
    print("Converting session summaries to HTML...")

    WEBSITE_DIR.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)

    for md_file in sorted(DOCS_DIR.glob('*.md')):
        print(f"  Converting {md_file.name}...")

        md_content = md_file.read_text()
        # Extract title from first line
        title = md_content.split('\n')[0].strip('# ')

        html = generate_session_html(title, md_content)

        output_file = WEBSITE_DIR / md_file.name.replace('.md', '.html')
        output_file.write_text(html)

        print(f"    → {output_file.name}")

    print(f"\n✓ Session summaries converted")

        output_file.write_text(html)

        print(f"    → {output_file.name}")

    print(f"\n✓ Session summaries converted")

Excellent! The website generation scripts now:

1. **Extract the GitHub URL** from git remote origin (converting SSH to HTTPS format)
2. **Update the homepage** with the actual GitHub repository link (https://github.com/itisrazza/ClankerOS)

   - Each session summary page (linking to the Markdown file in `docs/sessions/`)

This makes it easy for visitors to navigate between the rendered documentation and the source files on GitHub!

#!/usr/bin/env python3 """ Generate static website for ClankerOS documentation. Converts JSONL chatlogs to readable HTML pages. """ import json import os import subprocess from pathlib import Path from datetime import datetime from html import escape # Project root PROJECT_ROOT = Path(__file__).parent.parent DOCS_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'docs' WEBSITE_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'website' OUTPUTS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'outputs' SESSIONS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'sessions' def get_github_url(): """Get GitHub repository URL from git remote.""" try: result = subprocess.run( ['git', 'remote', 'get-url', 'origin'], cwd=PROJECT_ROOT, capture_output=True, text=True, check=True ) url = result.stdout.strip() # Convert SSH URL to HTTPS if url.startswith('git@github.com:'): url = url.replace('git@github.com:', 'https://github.com/') if url.endswith('.git'): url = url[:-4] return url except: return 'https://github.com/yourusername/clankeros' def extract_text_content(content): """Extract text from message content (handles both array and string formats).""" if isinstance(content, str): return content elif isinstance(content, list): text_parts = [] for item in content: if isinstance(item, dict): if item.get('type') == 'text': text_parts.append(item.get('text', '')) elif item.get('type') == 'tool_use': tool_name = item.get('name', 'unknown') text_parts.append(f'[Tool: {tool_name}]') elif isinstance(item, str): text_parts.append(item) return '\n'.join(text_parts) return '' def format_timestamp(timestamp_str): """Format ISO timestamp to human-readable format.""" try: dt = datetime.fromisoformat(timestamp_str.replace('Z', '+00:00')) return dt.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') except: return timestamp_str def parse_jsonl(file_path): """Parse JSONL file and extract messages.""" messages = [] with open(file_path, 'r') as f: for line in f: line = line.strip() if not line: continue try: entry = json.loads(line) # Skip queue operations and summaries for now if entry.get('type') in ['queue-operation']: continue # Handle summary entries if entry.get('type') == 'summary': messages.append({ 'role': 'summary', 'content': entry.get('summary', ''), 'timestamp': None }) continue # Handle regular messages if 'message' in entry: msg = entry['message'] role = msg.get('role', entry.get('type', 'unknown')) content = extract_text_content(msg.get('content', '')) timestamp = entry.get('timestamp') messages.append({ 'role': role, 'content': content, 'timestamp': timestamp, 'error': entry.get('error'), 'uuid': entry.get('uuid') }) except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f"Warning: Failed to parse line in {file_path}: {e}") continue return messages def generate_chatlog_html(session_id, session_name, messages, github_url): """Generate HTML page for a chatlog.""" source_url = f"{github_url}/blob/main/docs/outputs/{session_id}.jsonl" html = f''' {escape(session_name)} - ClankerOS

\n' html += f'

Error: {escape(error)}

''' return html def generate_sessions_index(session_files): """Generate index page for session summaries.""" html = ''' Sessions - ClankerOS

ClankerOS

Sessions

    ''' for session_file in sorted(session_files): # Read first few lines to extract title with open(SESSIONS_DIR / session_file, 'r') as f: title = f.readline().strip('# \n') html += f'''
  • {escape(title)}
    • ''' html += '''
''' return html def main(): """Main function to generate website.""" print("Generating ClankerOS website...") # Get GitHub URL github_url = get_github_url() print(f"GitHub URL: {github_url}") # Create output directories chatlogs_dir = WEBSITE_DIR / 'chatlogs' sessions_web_dir = WEBSITE_DIR / 'sessions' chatlogs_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) sessions_web_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) # Update homepage with GitHub URL homepage = WEBSITE_DIR / 'index.html' if homepage.exists(): content = homepage.read_text() content = content.replace( 'https://github.com/yourusername/clankeros', github_url ) homepage.write_text(content) # Process JSONL chatlogs print("\nProcessing chatlogs...") chatlogs = [] for jsonl_file in OUTPUTS_DIR.glob('*.jsonl'): # Skip empty files if jsonl_file.stat().st_size == 0: continue session_id = jsonl_file.stem # Skip agent files for now if session_id.startswith('agent-'): continue print(f" Processing {session_id}...") messages = parse_jsonl(jsonl_file) if not messages: print(f" Skipped (no messages)") continue # Use first user message as session name, or default session_name = f"Session {session_id[:8]}" for msg in messages: if msg['role'] == 'user' and msg['content']: # Use first line of first user message first_line = msg['content'].split('\n')[0][:100] if first_line: session_name = first_line break # Generate HTML html = generate_chatlog_html(session_id, session_name, messages, github_url) output_file = chatlogs_dir / f"{session_id}.html" output_file.write_text(html) chatlogs.append({ 'id': session_id, 'name': session_name, 'message_count': len(messages) }) print(f" Generated {output_file.name} ({len(messages)} messages)") # Generate chatlog index if chatlogs: print("\nGenerating chatlog index...") chatlog_index = generate_chatlog_index(chatlogs) (WEBSITE_DIR / 'chatlogs.html').write_text(chatlog_index) # Process session summaries (convert markdown to HTML later) # For now, just create an index print("\nProcessing session summaries...") session_files = list(SESSIONS_DIR.glob('*.md')) if session_files: sessions_index = generate_sessions_index([f.name for f in session_files]) (WEBSITE_DIR / 'sessions.html').write_text(sessions_index) print(f"\n✓ Website generated in {WEBSITE_DIR}") print(f" - {len(chatlogs)} chatlogs") print(f" - {len(session_files)} session summaries") if __name__ == '__main__': main()

Process JSONL chatlogs print("\nProcessing chatlogs...") chatlogs = [] for jsonl_file in OUTPUTS_DIR.glob('*.jsonl'): # Skip empty files if jsonl_file.stat().st_size == 0: continue session_id = jsonl_file.stem # Skip agent files for now if session_id.startswith('agent-'): continue print(f" Processing {session_id}...") messages = parse_jsonl(jsonl_file) if not messages: print(f" Skipped (no messages)") continue # Use first user message as session name, or default session_name = f"Session {session_id[:8]}" for msg in messages: if msg['role'] == 'user' and msg['content']: # Use first line of first user message first_line = msg['content'].split('\n')[0][:100] if first_line: session_name = first_line break # Generate HTML html = generate_chatlog_html(session_id, session_name, messages, github_url) output_file = chatlogs_dir / f"{session_id}.html" output_file.write_text(html) chatlogs.append({ 'id': session_id, 'name': session_name, 'message_count': len(messages) }) print(f" Generated {output_file.name} ({len(messages)} messages)") # Generate chatlog index if chatlogs: print("\nGenerating chatlog index...") chatlog_index = generate_chatlog_index(chatlogs) (WEBSITE_DIR / 'chatlogs.html').write_text(chatlog_index) # Process session summaries (convert markdown to HTML later) # For now, just create an index print("\nProcessing session summaries...") session_files = list(SESSIONS_DIR.glob('*.md')) if session_files: sessions_index = generate_sessions_index([f.name for f in session_files]) (WEBSITE_DIR / 'sessions.html').write_text(sessions_index) print(f"\n✓ Website generated in {WEBSITE_DIR}") print(f" - {len(chatlogs)} chatlogs") print(f" - {len(session_files)} session summaries") if __name__ == '__main__': main()

#!/usr/bin/env python3 """ Generate static website for ClankerOS documentation. Converts JSONL chatlogs to readable HTML pages. """ import json import os import subprocess from pathlib import Path from datetime import datetime from html import escape # Project root PROJECT_ROOT = Path(__file__).parent.parent DOCS_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'docs' WEBSITE_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'website' OUTPUTS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'outputs' SESSIONS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'sessions' def get_github_url(): """Get GitHub repository URL from git remote.""" try: result = subprocess.run( ['git', 'remote', 'get-url', 'origin'], cwd=PROJECT_ROOT, capture_output=True, text=True, check=True ) url = result.stdout.strip() # Convert SSH URL to HTTPS if url.startswith('git@github.com:'): url = url.replace('git@github.com:', 'https://github.com/') if url.endswith('.git'): url = url[:-4] return url except: return 'https://github.com/yourusername/clankeros' def extract_content_parts(content): """Extract text and tool calls from message content.""" text_parts = [] tool_calls = [] if isinstance(content, str): return content, [] elif isinstance(content, list): for item in content: if isinstance(item, dict): if item.get('type') == 'text': text_parts.append(item.get('text', '')) elif item.get('type') == 'tool_use': tool_calls.append({ 'name': item.get('name', 'unknown'), 'input': item.get('input', {}), 'id': item.get('id', '') }) elif isinstance(item, str): text_parts.append(item) return '\n'.join(text_parts), tool_calls return '', [] def format_timestamp(timestamp_str): """Format ISO timestamp to human-readable format.""" try: dt = datetime.fromisoformat(timestamp_str.replace('Z', '+00:00')) return dt.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') except: return timestamp_str def parse_jsonl(file_path): """Parse JSONL file and extract messages.""" messages = [] with open(file_path, 'r') as f: for line in f: line = line.strip() if not line: continue try: entry = json.loads(line) # Skip queue operations and summaries for now if entry.get('type') in ['queue-operation']: continue # Handle summary entries if entry.get('type') == 'summary': messages.append({ 'role': 'summary', 'content': entry.get('summary', ''), 'timestamp': None }) continue # Handle regular messages if 'message' in entry: msg = entry['message'] role = msg.get('role', entry.get('type', 'unknown')) content, tool_calls = extract_content_parts(msg.get('content', '')) timestamp = entry.get('timestamp') messages.append({ 'role': role, 'content': content, 'tool_calls': tool_calls, 'timestamp': timestamp, 'error': entry.get('error'), 'uuid': entry.get('uuid') }) except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f"Warning: Failed to parse line in {file_path}: {e}") continue return messages def generate_chatlog_html(session_id, session_name, messages, github_url): """Generate HTML page for a chatlog.""" source_url = f"{github_url}/blob/main/docs/outputs/{session_id}.jsonl" html = f''' {escape(session_name)} - ClankerOS

ClankerOS

{escape(session_name)}

← Back to chatlogs | View source on GitHub

''' for msg in messages: role = msg['role'] content = msg['content'] tool_calls = msg.get('tool_calls', []) timestamp = msg.get('timestamp') error = msg.get('error') role_class = role.replace('_', '-') role_display = role.replace('_', ' ').title() html += f'
\n' html += f'
\n' html += f' {escape(role_display)}\n' if timestamp: html += f' {escape(format_timestamp(timestamp))}\n' html += f'
\n' if content: html += f'
{escape(content)}
\n' # Add tool calls as collapsible sections for tool_call in tool_calls: tool_name = tool_call['name'] tool_input = json.dumps(tool_call['input'], indent=2) html += f'
\n' html += f' Tool: {escape(tool_name)}\n' html += f' 
{escape(tool_input)}
\n' html += f'
\n' if error: html += f'
Error: {escape(error)}
\n' html += f'
\n' html += '''
''' return html def generate_chatlog_index(chatlogs): """Generate index page for chatlogs.""" html = ''' Chatlogs - ClankerOS

ClankerOS

Chatlogs

    ''' for chatlog in sorted(chatlogs, key=lambda x: x['name']): name = chatlog['name'] session_id = chatlog['id'] message_count = chatlog['message_count'] html += f'''
  • {escape(name)} ({message_count} messages)
    • ''' html += '''
''' return html def generate_sessions_index(session_files): """Generate index page for session summaries.""" html = ''' Sessions - ClankerOS

ClankerOS

Sessions

    ''' for session_file in sorted(session_files): # Read first few lines to extract title with open(SESSIONS_DIR / session_file, 'r') as f: title = f.readline().strip('# \n') html += f'''
  • {escape(title)}
    • ''' html += '''
''' return html def main(): """Main function to generate website.""" print("Generating ClankerOS website...") # Get GitHub URL github_url = get_github_url() print(f"GitHub URL: {github_url}") # Create output directories chatlogs_dir = WEBSITE_DIR / 'chatlogs' sessions_web_dir = WEBSITE_DIR / 'sessions' chatlogs_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) sessions_web_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) # Update homepage with GitHub URL homepage = WEBSITE_DIR / 'index.html' if homepage.exists(): content = homepage.read_text() content = content.replace( 'https://github.com/yourusername/clankeros', github_url ) homepage.write_text(content) # Process JSONL chatlogs print("\nProcessing chatlogs...") chatlogs = [] for jsonl_file in OUTPUTS_DIR.glob('*.jsonl'): # Skip empty files if jsonl_file.stat().st_size == 0: continue session_id = jsonl_file.stem # Skip agent files for now if session_id.startswith('agent-'): continue print(f" Processing {session_id}...") messages = parse_jsonl(jsonl_file) if not messages: print(f" Skipped (no messages)") continue # Use first user message as session name, or default session_name = f"Session {session_id[:8]}" for msg in messages: if msg['role'] == 'user' and msg['content']: # Use first line of first user message first_line = msg['content'].split('\n')[0][:100] if first_line: session_name = first_line break # Generate HTML html = generate_chatlog_html(session_id, session_name, messages, github_url) output_file = chatlogs_dir / f"{session_id}.html" output_file.write_text(html) chatlogs.append({ 'id': session_id, 'name': session_name, 'message_count': len(messages) }) print(f" Generated {output_file.name} ({len(messages)} messages)") # Generate chatlog index if chatlogs: print("\nGenerating chatlog index...") chatlog_index = generate_chatlog_index(chatlogs) (WEBSITE_DIR / 'chatlogs.html').write_text(chatlog_index) # Process session summaries (convert markdown to HTML later) # For now, just create an index print("\nProcessing session summaries...") session_files = list(SESSIONS_DIR.glob('*.md')) if session_files: sessions_index = generate_sessions_index([f.name for f in session_files]) (WEBSITE_DIR / 'sessions.html').write_text(sessions_index) print(f"\n✓ Website generated in {WEBSITE_DIR}") print(f" - {len(chatlogs)} chatlogs") print(f" - {len(session_files)} session summaries") if __name__ == '__main__': main()

#!/usr/bin/env python3 """ Generate static website for ClankerOS documentation. Converts JSONL chatlogs to readable HTML pages. """ import json import os import subprocess from pathlib import Path from datetime import datetime from html import escape # Project root PROJECT_ROOT = Path(__file__).parent.parent DOCS_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'docs' WEBSITE_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'website' OUTPUTS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'outputs' SESSIONS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'sessions' def get_github_url(): """Get GitHub repository URL from git remote.""" try: result = subprocess.run( ['git', 'remote', 'get-url', 'origin'], cwd=PROJECT_ROOT, capture_output=True, text=True, check=True ) url = result.stdout.strip() # Convert SSH URL to HTTPS if url.startswith('git@github.com:'): url = url.replace('git@github.com:', 'https://github.com/') if url.endswith('.git'): url = url[:-4] return url except: return 'https://github.com/yourusername/clankeros' def extract_content_parts(content): """Extract text and tool calls from message content.""" text_parts = [] tool_calls = [] if isinstance(content, str): return content, [] elif isinstance(content, list): for item in content: if isinstance(item, dict): if item.get('type') == 'text': text_parts.append(item.get('text', '')) elif item.get('type') == 'tool_use': tool_calls.append({ 'name': item.get('name', 'unknown'), 'input': item.get('input', {}), 'id': item.get('id', '') }) elif isinstance(item, str): text_parts.append(item) return '\n'.join(text_parts), tool_calls return '', [] def format_timestamp(timestamp_str): """Format ISO timestamp to human-readable format.""" try: dt = datetime.fromisoformat(timestamp_str.replace('Z', '+00:00')) return dt.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') except: return timestamp_str def parse_jsonl(file_path): """Parse JSONL file and extract messages.""" messages = [] with open(file_path, 'r') as f: for line in f: line = line.strip() if not line: continue try: entry = json.loads(line) # Skip queue operations and summaries for now if entry.get('type') in ['queue-operation']: continue # Handle summary entries if entry.get('type') == 'summary': messages.append({ 'role': 'summary', 'content': entry.get('summary', ''), 'timestamp': None }) continue # Handle regular messages if 'message' in entry: msg = entry['message'] role = msg.get('role', entry.get('type', 'unknown')) content, tool_calls = extract_content_parts(msg.get('content', '')) timestamp = entry.get('timestamp') messages.append({ 'role': role, 'content': content, 'tool_calls': tool_calls, 'timestamp': timestamp, 'error': entry.get('error'), 'uuid': entry.get('uuid') }) except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f"Warning: Failed to parse line in {file_path}: {e}") continue return messages def generate_chatlog_html(session_id, session_name, messages, github_url): """Generate HTML page for a chatlog.""" source_url = f"{github_url}/blob/main/docs/outputs/{session_id}.jsonl" html = f''' {escape(session_name)} - ClankerOS

ClankerOS

{escape(session_name)}

← Back to chatlogs | View source on GitHub

''' for msg in messages: role = msg['role'] content = msg['content'] tool_calls = msg.get('tool_calls', []) timestamp = msg.get('timestamp') error = msg.get('error') role_class = role.replace('_', '-') role_display = role.replace('_', ' ').title() html += f'
\n' html += f'
\n' html += f' {escape(role_display)}\n' if timestamp: html += f' {escape(format_timestamp(timestamp))}\n' html += f'
\n' if content: html += f'
{escape(content)}
\n' # Add tool calls as collapsible sections for tool_call in tool_calls: tool_name = tool_call['name'] tool_input = tool_call['input'] # Format common tools nicely if tool_name == 'Bash': command = tool_input.get('command', '') desc = tool_input.get('description', '') html += f'
\n' html += f' $\n' html += f' {escape(command)}\n' if desc: html += f' {escape(desc)}\n' html += f'
\n' elif tool_name == 'Write': file_path = tool_input.get('file_path', '') html += f'
\n' html += f' 📝\n' html += f' Writing to {escape(file_path)}\n' html += f'
\n' elif tool_name == 'Edit': file_path = tool_input.get('file_path', '') html += f'
\n' html += f' ✏️\n' html += f' Editing {escape(file_path)}\n' html += f'
\n' elif tool_name == 'Read': file_path = tool_input.get('file_path', '') html += f'
\n' html += f' 👁️\n' html += f' Reading {escape(file_path)}\n' html += f'
\n' elif tool_name == 'TodoWrite': html += f'
\n' html += f' ✓\n' html += f' Updating todo list\n' html += f'
\n' elif tool_name == 'Glob': pattern = tool_input.get('pattern', '') html += f'
\n' html += f' 🔍\n' html += f' Finding files: {escape(pattern)}\n' html += f'
\n' elif tool_name == 'Grep': pattern = tool_input.get('pattern', '') html += f'
\n' html += f' 🔍\n' html += f' Searching for: {escape(pattern)}\n' html += f'
\n' else: # For other tools, show the full JSON in a collapsible section tool_input_json = json.dumps(tool_input, indent=2) html += f'
\n' html += f' Tool: {escape(tool_name)}\n' html += f' 
{escape(tool_input_json)}
\n' html += f'
\n' if error: html += f'
Error: {escape(error)}
\n' html += f'
\n' html += '''
''' return html def generate_chatlog_index(chatlogs): """Generate index page for chatlogs.""" html = ''' Chatlogs - ClankerOS

ClankerOS

Chatlogs

    ''' for chatlog in sorted(chatlogs, key=lambda x: x['name']): name = chatlog['name'] session_id = chatlog['id'] message_count = chatlog['message_count'] html += f'''
  • {escape(name)} ({message_count} messages)
    • ''' html += '''
''' return html def generate_sessions_index(session_files): """Generate index page for session summaries.""" html = ''' Sessions - ClankerOS

ClankerOS

Sessions

    ''' for session_file in sorted(session_files): # Read first few lines to extract title with open(SESSIONS_DIR / session_file, 'r') as f: title = f.readline().strip('# \n') html += f'''
  • {escape(title)}
    • ''' html += '''
''' return html def main(): """Main function to generate website.""" print("Generating ClankerOS website...") # Get GitHub URL github_url = get_github_url() print(f"GitHub URL: {github_url}") # Create output directories chatlogs_dir = WEBSITE_DIR / 'chatlogs' sessions_web_dir = WEBSITE_DIR / 'sessions' chatlogs_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) sessions_web_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) # Update homepage with GitHub URL homepage = WEBSITE_DIR / 'index.html' if homepage.exists(): content = homepage.read_text() content = content.replace( 'https://github.com/yourusername/clankeros', github_url ) homepage.write_text(content) # Process JSONL chatlogs print("\nProcessing chatlogs...") chatlogs = [] for jsonl_file in OUTPUTS_DIR.glob('*.jsonl'): # Skip empty files if jsonl_file.stat().st_size == 0: continue session_id = jsonl_file.stem # Skip agent files for now if session_id.startswith('agent-'): continue print(f" Processing {session_id}...") messages = parse_jsonl(jsonl_file) if not messages: print(f" Skipped (no messages)") continue # Use first user message as session name, or default session_name = f"Session {session_id[:8]}" for msg in messages: if msg['role'] == 'user' and msg['content']: # Use first line of first user message first_line = msg['content'].split('\n')[0][:100] if first_line: session_name = first_line break # Generate HTML html = generate_chatlog_html(session_id, session_name, messages, github_url) output_file = chatlogs_dir / f"{session_id}.html" output_file.write_text(html) chatlogs.append({ 'id': session_id, 'name': session_name, 'message_count': len(messages) }) print(f" Generated {output_file.name} ({len(messages)} messages)") # Generate chatlog index if chatlogs: print("\nGenerating chatlog index...") chatlog_index = generate_chatlog_index(chatlogs) (WEBSITE_DIR / 'chatlogs.html').write_text(chatlog_index) # Process session summaries (convert markdown to HTML later) # For now, just create an index print("\nProcessing session summaries...") session_files = list(SESSIONS_DIR.glob('*.md')) if session_files: sessions_index = generate_sessions_index([f.name for f in session_files]) (WEBSITE_DIR / 'sessions.html').write_text(sessions_index) print(f"\n✓ Website generated in {WEBSITE_DIR}") print(f" - {len(chatlogs)} chatlogs") print(f" - {len(session_files)} session summaries") if __name__ == '__main__': main()

This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The conversation is summarized below: Analysis: Let me chronologically analyze this conversation about creating a documentation website for ClankerOS. **Initial Context:** - User copied Claude Code project outputs to `docs/outputs/` directory - Asked about potential personal information in JSONL files - I identified: username (`razz`), file paths, timestamps, and conversation content as personal info **Main Request:** - User wants to build a small documentation website for GitHub Pages - Not much marketing, just presenting: Doxygen docs, chatlogs in viewable format, and session summaries - Should be minimal and clean **Initial Implementation (Jekyll approach - REJECTED):** - I started with Jekyll/GitHub Pages standard approach - User rejected this, wants website built from separate `website/` directory using GitHub Actions - No restriction to Jekyll since GitHub Actions will build it **First Website Iteration - Basic Structure:** - Created `website/` directory with HTML/CSS/JS - Homepage with cards, navigation, header/footer - User feedback: "looks a bit basic in a very amateurish way" - User wants simpler homepage with just links to documentation sections **Styling Changes - Minimal Design:** - User requested: no header/footer/nav bars, no colored blocks, simple sans-serif font - Changed to: Inter/system-ui font, black text on white, no underlines except on hover - Removed all marketing fluff and decorative elements - User feedback on links: "I'm having a bit of trouble distinguishing what I can click on" - Added blue color (#0066cc) to links, kept h1 links black **GitHub Integration:** - User requested: "get the actual GitHub link from Git origin on home page" - Also wanted links to source files on GitHub for summaries and chatlogs - Implemented git remote parsing to extract repo URL - Added "View source on GitHub" links to all chatlog and session pages **Chatlog Improvements - Tool Calls:** - User: "I'd like them to include the tool calls inputs and outputs. They can get pretty big, so make them collapsable with
" - Implemented tool call extraction from JSONL - Created collapsible sections for tool calls **Tool Call Formatting - Claude Code Style:** - User: "For fairly common tools, like Write, TodoWrite, Bash. Can you make it so it appears like does in Claude Code?" - Implemented special formatting for common tools: - Bash: ⚙️ icon with command - Write: 📝 with file path - Edit: ✏️ with file path - Read: 👁️ with file path - TodoWrite: ✓ icon - Glob/Grep: 🔍 with pattern - Less common tools: expandable details with JSON **Final Adjustments:** - User: "The content it's writing has disappeared. I would still like it to be present, but collapsible." - User: "Also the ` at the front of command-line invocations looks a bit weird" - Changed Bash icon from ` to ⚙️ - Made Write/Edit/Bash show content in collapsible details - Edit shows old/new strings in diff format with colored labels **Key Technical Details:** 1. **File Structure:** - `website/` - static site directory - `scripts/generate_website.py` - converts JSONL to HTML - `scripts/convert_markdown.py` - converts MD sessions to HTML - `.github/workflows/docs.yml` - GitHub Actions deployment - `Doxyfile` - API documentation config 2. **Makefile Targets:** - All targets marked as `.PHONY` (important fix for `docs` target) - `make website` - generates everything - `make docs` - runs Doxygen - `make serve-website` - local preview server 3. **JSONL Parsing:** - Extracts messages from session logs - Handles both string and array content formats - Parses tool_use blocks for tool calls - Skips queue-operation and summary entries 4. **CSS Styling:** - Minimal design: black on white, simple sans-serif - Links: #0066cc blue - Tool calls: collapsible details with border-left styling - Compact tool calls: special class for common tools with content Summary: 1. **Primary Request and Intent:** - Build a documentation website for ClankerOS to be published on GitHub Pages - Website should present three main sections: Doxygen API documentation, viewable chatlogs, and session summaries - Minimal design with no marketing fluff - just straightforward documentation - Website built in separate `website/` directory, deployed via GitHub Actions (not restricted to Jekyll) - Clean, simple design with sans-serif font (Inter/system-ui), no colored blocks or heavy styling - Include GitHub repository link extracted from git remote origin - Add links from chatlogs and session summaries back to their source files on GitHub - Display tool calls in chatlogs with inputs/outputs in collapsible format - Format common tools (Bash, Write, Edit, Read, TodoWrite, Glob, Grep) similar to Claude Code UI - Keep tool call content visible but collapsible 2. **Key Technical Concepts:** - **GitHub Pages**: Static site hosting for documentation - **GitHub Actions**: Automated build and deployment workflow - **Doxygen**: API documentation generator for C/C++ code - **JSONL**: Format for Claude Code session logs - **Markdown to HTML**: Conversion for session summaries - **Static Site Generation**: Python scripts generate HTML from source files - **Collapsible Details**: HTML `
` element for expandable content - **Git Remote Parsing**: Extract GitHub URL from repository configuration - **Minimal Web Design**: Black text on white, simple typography, no frameworks 3. **Files and Code Sections:** - **`website/index.html`** - Homepage - Simplified to just list links to documentation sections - No header/footer/nav, just container with links ```html

ClankerOS

  • Session Summaries
  • Chatlogs
  • API Documentation
  • GitHub Repository

\n' ``` - **`scripts/convert_markdown.py`** - Session summary converter - Converts Markdown to HTML with simple parser - Adds GitHub source links to each session page ```python def generate_session_html(title, md_content, filename, github_url): html_content = convert_markdown_to_html(md_content) source_url = f"{github_url}/blob/main/docs/sessions/{filename}" # Returns HTML with link back to GitHub ``` - **`.github/workflows/docs.yml`** - GitHub Actions workflow - Builds website on push to main - Installs Python, Doxygen, Graphviz - Runs generation scripts and Doxygen - Deploys to GitHub Pages ```yaml - name: Generate website from chatlogs and sessions run: | python3 scripts/generate_website.py python3 scripts/convert_markdown.py - name: Generate Doxygen documentation run: doxygen Doxyfile ``` - **`Doxyfile`** - Doxygen configuration - Generates API docs from kernel/ and libraries/ - Outputs to website/api/ - Enables call graphs and source browser - **`Makefile`** - Build system integration - Added `.PHONY` declaration for all targets (critical fix) - Website generation targets: ```makefile .PHONY: all kernel programs libraries clean run run-serial debug toolchain website docs serve-website help website: docs @echo "Generating website..." python3 scripts/generate_website.py python3 scripts/convert_markdown.py @echo "Done! API docs generated in website/api/" serve-website: website @echo "Starting local server at http://localhost:8000" @cd website && python3 -m http.server 8000 ``` - **`.gitignore`** - Excluded generated files - Added entries for generated HTML and API docs: ``` website/chatlogs/*.html website/sessions/*.html website/api/ ``` 4. **Errors and Fixes:** - **Error: Makefile `docs` target not running** - Problem: `docs` target wasn't marked as `.PHONY`, so Make thought it was up-to-date because `docs/` directory exists - Fix: Added `docs` to `.PHONY` declaration line - User feedback: "The docs task isn't marked as phony in the Makefile, and won't generate the docs because the real docs folder already exists" - **Error: Initial design too "amateurish"** - Problem: First design had too much marketing material, colored blocks, cards, headers/footers - User feedback: "The website looks a bit basic in a very amateurish way" - Fix: Simplified to minimal design with just links, removed all decorative elements - **Error: Links not distinguishable** - Problem: Black links on black text made it hard to tell what's clickable - User feedback: "Some colour and underlines are ok for links. I'm having a bit of trouble distinguishing what I can click on." - Fix: Changed link color to #0066cc blue, kept h1 links black for site title - **Error: Tool call content disappeared** - Problem: Made tool calls too compact, lost the actual content being written/executed - User feedback: "The content it's writing has disappeared. I would still like it to be present, but collapsible." - Fix: Changed from inline divs to `
` elements for Bash/Write/Edit, keeping content in expandable section - **Error: Bash `$` icon looked weird** - Problem: Dollar sign as tool icon was separated and didn't look right - User feedback: "Also the `$` at the front of command-line invocations looks a bit weird and separated out from the content. Is there a different emoji you can use for that?" - Fix: Changed from `$` to ⚙️ emoji for Bash commands 5. **Problem Solving:** - **Privacy concerns with JSONL files**: Identified personal information (username, paths, timestamps) in chatlog files. User decided to keep them as-is for transparency. - **Website architecture**: Moved from Jekyll-based approach to custom Python static site generation to avoid framework limitations while using GitHub Actions. - **GitHub URL extraction**: Implemented subprocess call to `git remote get-url origin` and conversion from SSH to HTTPS format for consistent links. - **Tool call presentation**: Evolved from hiding content → inline display → collapsible details based on user feedback, balancing information density with readability. - **Markdown parsing**: Created simple custom parser for session summaries supporting headers, lists, code blocks, bold/italic, and links without external dependencies. 6. **All User Messages:** - "I've copied the project outputs (~/.claude/projects/$path) to docs/outputs. Is there likely to be any personal information in there I'd not want out on the internet?" - "I want to build a small website to document this project. It will be published on GitHub Pages. I don't want much marketing of the project, but to present Doxygen documentation for the code, a more viewable format for the chatlogs and to have the session summaries more visible." - "I want the website to be built from a separate directory (website). We'll be using GitHub actions to build the website, so we don't have to restrict ourselves to Jekyll" - "The website looks a bit basic in a very amateurish way. First things first, the home page. Can we simplify that so that it just includes a link to the GitHub repo, session summaries, chat logs and API docs? We don't need all the extra marketing project info material." - "We don't really need the heading and footer either, or all that stying. Let's just have it use a simple sans-serif font (Adwaita Mono, Inter, or system-provided sans-serif). No underlines, not filled colour blocks." - "Some colour and underlines are ok for links. I'm having a bit of trouble distinguishing what I can click on." - "You can get the actual GitHub link from the Git `origin` on the home page. It would also be awesome for the summaries and chat logs to have links to their counter parts on GitHub." - "Looking into the chatlogs. I'd like them to include the tool calls inputs and outputs. They can get pretty big, so make them collapsable with
." - "For fairly common tools, like Write, TodoWrite, Bash. Can you make it so it appears like does in Claude Code?" - "The content it's writing has disappeared. I would still like it to be present, but collapsible. Also the `$` at the front of command-line invocations looks a bit weird and separated out from the content. Is there a different emoji you can use for that?" 7. **Pending Tasks:** - None explicitly requested - website generation is complete and functional 8. **Current Work:** Immediately before the summary request, I was finalizing the tool call display formatting in chatlogs. The user had two concerns: 1. The content from Write/Edit/Bash tools had disappeared when I made them inline 2. The `$` icon for Bash commands looked "weird and separated" I fixed both issues by: - Converting Bash, Write, and Edit to use `
` - Changing Bash icon from `$` to ⚙️ - Adding content display in collapsible sections: - Bash: shows command content if present - Write: shows file content if present - Edit: shows old/new strings in colored diff format - Updated CSS with `.tool-call-compact` class for special styling The last code changes were in `scripts/generate_website.py` (tool formatting) and `website/css/style.css` (compact tool call styling and diff colors). Generated website successfully with: - 3 chatlogs processed (147, 5, and 1516 messages respectively) - 2 session summaries converted - GitHub URL correctly extracted: https://github.com/itisrazza/ClankerOS 9. **Optional Next Step:** No next step required. I've completed the requested changes to the chatlog tool call display. The website is now fully functional with:

1. **Tool call content is now collapsible** - Common tools (Bash, Write, Edit) now use `<details>` elements so their content can be expanded/collapsed
2. **Bash icon changed** - Replaced the `$` symbol with the ⚙️ emoji which looks more integrated

The changes I made:

- **[scripts/generate_website.py](scripts/generate_website.py)**: Updated tool formatting to use `<details class="tool-call tool-call-compact">` for Bash, Write, and Edit tools, with their content displayed in collapsible sections
- **[website/css/style.css](website/css/style.css)**: Added `.tool-call-compact` class styling with border-left accent and diff color formatting for Edit operations (red for old, green for new)

You can test the website locally with:
```bash
make serve-website
```

And when you're ready, push to GitHub to deploy via GitHub Actions. The chatlogs will now show tool calls in a clean, collapsible format similar to Claude Code's interface.

    45→def extract_content_parts(content):
    46→    """Extract text and tool calls from message content."""
    47→    text_parts = []
    48→    tool_calls = []
    49→
    50→    if isinstance(content, str):
    51→        return content, []
    52→    elif isinstance(content, list):
    53→        for item in content:
    54→            if isinstance(item, dict):
    55→                if item.get('type') == 'text':
    56→                    text_parts.append(item.get('text', ''))
    57→                elif item.get('type') == 'tool_use':
    58→                    tool_calls.append({
    59→                        'name': item.get('name', 'unknown'),
    60→                        'input': item.get('input', {}),
    61→                        'id': item.get('id', '')
    62→                    })
    63→            elif isinstance(item, str):
    64→                text_parts.append(item)
    65→        return '\n'.join(text_parts), tool_calls
    66→    return '', []

#!/usr/bin/env python3 """ Generate static website for ClankerOS documentation. Converts JSONL chatlogs to readable HTML pages. """ import json import os import subprocess from pathlib import Path from datetime import datetime from html import escape # Project root PROJECT_ROOT = Path(__file__).parent.parent DOCS_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'docs' WEBSITE_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'website' OUTPUTS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'outputs' SESSIONS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'sessions' def get_github_url(): """Get GitHub repository URL from git remote.""" try: result = subprocess.run( ['git', 'remote', 'get-url', 'origin'], cwd=PROJECT_ROOT, capture_output=True, text=True, check=True ) url = result.stdout.strip() # Convert SSH URL to HTTPS if url.startswith('git@github.com:'): url = url.replace('git@github.com:', 'https://github.com/') if url.endswith('.git'): url = url[:-4] return url except: return 'https://github.com/yourusername/clankeros' def extract_content_parts(content): """Extract text and tool calls from message content.""" text_parts = [] tool_calls = [] if isinstance(content, str): return content, [] elif isinstance(content, list): for item in content: if isinstance(item, dict): if item.get('type') == 'text': text_parts.append(item.get('text', '')) elif item.get('type') == 'tool_use': tool_calls.append({ 'name': item.get('name', 'unknown'), 'input': item.get('input', {}), 'id': item.get('id', '') }) elif isinstance(item, str): text_parts.append(item) return '\n'.join(text_parts), tool_calls return '', [] def format_timestamp(timestamp_str): """Format ISO timestamp to human-readable format.""" try: dt = datetime.fromisoformat(timestamp_str.replace('Z', '+00:00')) return dt.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') except: return timestamp_str def parse_jsonl(file_path): """Parse JSONL file and extract messages.""" messages = [] with open(file_path, 'r') as f: for line in f: line = line.strip() if not line: continue try: entry = json.loads(line) # Skip queue operations and summaries for now if entry.get('type') in ['queue-operation']: continue # Handle summary entries if entry.get('type') == 'summary': messages.append({ 'role': 'summary', 'content': entry.get('summary', ''), 'timestamp': None }) continue # Handle regular messages if 'message' in entry: msg = entry['message'] role = msg.get('role', entry.get('type', 'unknown')) content, tool_calls = extract_content_parts(msg.get('content', '')) timestamp = entry.get('timestamp') messages.append({ 'role': role, 'content': content, 'tool_calls': tool_calls, 'timestamp': timestamp, 'error': entry.get('error'), 'uuid': entry.get('uuid') }) except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f"Warning: Failed to parse line in {file_path}: {e}") continue return messages def generate_chatlog_html(session_id, session_name, messages, github_url): """Generate HTML page for a chatlog.""" source_url = f"{github_url}/blob/main/docs/outputs/{session_id}.jsonl" html = f''' {escape(session_name)} - ClankerOS

ClankerOS

{escape(session_name)}

← Back to chatlogs | View source on GitHub

''' for msg in messages: role = msg['role'] content = msg['content'] tool_calls = msg.get('tool_calls', []) timestamp = msg.get('timestamp') error = msg.get('error') role_class = role.replace('_', '-') role_display = role.replace('_', ' ').title() html += f'
\n' html += f'
\n' html += f' {escape(role_display)}\n' if timestamp: html += f' {escape(format_timestamp(timestamp))}\n' html += f'
\n' if content: html += f'
{escape(content)}
\n' # Add tool calls as collapsible sections for tool_call in tool_calls: tool_name = tool_call['name'] tool_input = tool_call['input'] # Format common tools nicely if tool_name == 'Bash': command = tool_input.get('command', '') desc = tool_input.get('description', '') content = tool_input.get('content', '') html += f'
\n' html += f' \n' html += f' ⚙️\n' html += f' {escape(command)}\n' if desc: html += f' {escape(desc)}\n' html += f' \n' if content: html += f' 
{escape(content)}
\n' html += f'
\n' elif tool_name == 'Write': file_path = tool_input.get('file_path', '') content = tool_input.get('content', '') html += f'
\n' html += f' \n' html += f' 📝\n' html += f' Writing to {escape(file_path)}\n' html += f' \n' if content: html += f' 
{escape(content)}
\n' html += f'
\n' elif tool_name == 'Edit': file_path = tool_input.get('file_path', '') old_string = tool_input.get('old_string', '') new_string = tool_input.get('new_string', '') html += f'
\n' html += f' \n' html += f' ✏️\n' html += f' Editing {escape(file_path)}\n' html += f' \n' if old_string or new_string: html += f'
\n' if old_string: html += f'
Old:
{escape(old_string)}
\n' if new_string: html += f'
New:
{escape(new_string)}
\n' html += f'
\n' html += f'
\n' elif tool_name == 'Read': file_path = tool_input.get('file_path', '') html += f'
\n' html += f' 👁️\n' html += f' Reading {escape(file_path)}\n' html += f'
\n' elif tool_name == 'TodoWrite': html += f'
\n' html += f' ✓\n' html += f' Updating todo list\n' html += f'
\n' elif tool_name == 'Glob': pattern = tool_input.get('pattern', '') html += f'
\n' html += f' 🔍\n' html += f' Finding files: {escape(pattern)}\n' html += f'
\n' elif tool_name == 'Grep': pattern = tool_input.get('pattern', '') html += f'
\n' html += f' 🔍\n' html += f' Searching for: {escape(pattern)}\n' html += f'
\n' else: # For other tools, show the full JSON in a collapsible section tool_input_json = json.dumps(tool_input, indent=2) html += f'
\n' html += f' Tool: {escape(tool_name)}\n' html += f' 
{escape(tool_input_json)}
\n' html += f'
\n' if error: html += f'
Error: {escape(error)}
\n' html += f'
\n' html += '''
''' return html def generate_chatlog_index(chatlogs): """Generate index page for chatlogs.""" html = ''' Chatlogs - ClankerOS

ClankerOS

Chatlogs

    ''' for chatlog in sorted(chatlogs, key=lambda x: x['name']): name = chatlog['name'] session_id = chatlog['id'] message_count = chatlog['message_count'] html += f'''
  • {escape(name)} ({message_count} messages)
    • ''' html += '''
''' return html def generate_sessions_index(session_files): """Generate index page for session summaries.""" html = ''' Sessions - ClankerOS

ClankerOS

Sessions

    ''' for session_file in sorted(session_files): # Read first few lines to extract title with open(SESSIONS_DIR / session_file, 'r') as f: title = f.readline().strip('# \n') html += f'''
  • {escape(title)}
    • ''' html += '''
''' return html def main(): """Main function to generate website.""" print("Generating ClankerOS website...") # Get GitHub URL github_url = get_github_url() print(f"GitHub URL: {github_url}") # Create output directories chatlogs_dir = WEBSITE_DIR / 'chatlogs' sessions_web_dir = WEBSITE_DIR / 'sessions' chatlogs_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) sessions_web_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) # Update homepage with GitHub URL homepage = WEBSITE_DIR / 'index.html' if homepage.exists(): content = homepage.read_text() content = content.replace( 'https://github.com/yourusername/clankeros', github_url ) homepage.write_text(content) # Process JSONL chatlogs print("\nProcessing chatlogs...") chatlogs = [] for jsonl_file in OUTPUTS_DIR.glob('*.jsonl'): # Skip empty files if jsonl_file.stat().st_size == 0: continue session_id = jsonl_file.stem # Skip agent files for now if session_id.startswith('agent-'): continue print(f" Processing {session_id}...") messages = parse_jsonl(jsonl_file) if not messages: print(f" Skipped (no messages)") continue # Use first user message as session name, or default session_name = f"Session {session_id[:8]}" for msg in messages: if msg['role'] == 'user' and msg['content']: # Use first line of first user message first_line = msg['content'].split('\n')[0][:100] if first_line: session_name = first_line break # Generate HTML html = generate_chatlog_html(session_id, session_name, messages, github_url) output_file = chatlogs_dir / f"{session_id}.html" output_file.write_text(html) chatlogs.append({ 'id': session_id, 'name': session_name, 'message_count': len(messages) }) print(f" Generated {output_file.name} ({len(messages)} messages)") # Generate chatlog index if chatlogs: print("\nGenerating chatlog index...") chatlog_index = generate_chatlog_index(chatlogs) (WEBSITE_DIR / 'chatlogs.html').write_text(chatlog_index) # Process session summaries (convert markdown to HTML later) # For now, just create an index print("\nProcessing session summaries...") session_files = list(SESSIONS_DIR.glob('*.md')) if session_files: sessions_index = generate_sessions_index([f.name for f in session_files]) (WEBSITE_DIR / 'sessions.html').write_text(sessions_index) print(f"\n✓ Website generated in {WEBSITE_DIR}") print(f" - {len(chatlogs)} chatlogs") print(f" - {len(session_files)} session summaries") if __name__ == '__main__': main()

content.text:
Perfect! The website has been regenerated. The issue was that user messages often contain multiple text blocks - one for `<ide_opened_file>` notifications and one for the actual user prompt. The extraction code was joining all text blocks together, which meant IDE notifications were showing up as if they were part of the user's message.

I've fixed it by filtering out any text blocks that start with `<ide_opened_file>` or `<system-reminder>` tags. Now only the actual user prompts should be displayed in the chatlogs.
<ide_opened_file>The user opened the file /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros/scripts/generate_website.py in the IDE. This may or may not be related to the current task.</ide_opened_file>
Can you filter user prompts without any text (with the file open/system reminder) tags.
Good catch! I should filter out user messages that have no actual content after removing the IDE/system reminder tags. Let me update the code:

#!/usr/bin/env python3 """ Generate static website for ClankerOS documentation. Converts JSONL chatlogs to readable HTML pages. """ import json import os import subprocess from pathlib import Path from datetime import datetime from html import escape # Project root PROJECT_ROOT = Path(__file__).parent.parent DOCS_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'docs' WEBSITE_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'website' OUTPUTS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'outputs' SESSIONS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'sessions' def get_github_url(): """Get GitHub repository URL from git remote.""" try: result = subprocess.run( ['git', 'remote', 'get-url', 'origin'], cwd=PROJECT_ROOT, capture_output=True, text=True, check=True ) url = result.stdout.strip() # Convert SSH URL to HTTPS if url.startswith('git@github.com:'): url = url.replace('git@github.com:', 'https://github.com/') if url.endswith('.git'): url = url[:-4] return url except: return 'https://github.com/yourusername/clankeros' def extract_content_parts(content): """Extract text and tool calls from message content.""" text_parts = [] tool_calls = [] if isinstance(content, str): return content, [] elif isinstance(content, list): for item in content: if isinstance(item, dict): if item.get('type') == 'text': text = item.get('text', '') # Skip IDE notification blocks if not text.startswith('') and not text.startswith(''): text_parts.append(text) elif item.get('type') == 'tool_use': tool_calls.append({ 'name': item.get('name', 'unknown'), 'input': item.get('input', {}), 'id': item.get('id', '') }) elif isinstance(item, str): text_parts.append(item) return '\n'.join(text_parts), tool_calls return '', [] def format_timestamp(timestamp_str): """Format ISO timestamp to human-readable format.""" try: dt = datetime.fromisoformat(timestamp_str.replace('Z', '+00:00')) return dt.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') except: return timestamp_str def parse_jsonl(file_path): """Parse JSONL file and extract messages.""" messages = [] with open(file_path, 'r') as f: for line in f: line = line.strip() if not line: continue try: entry = json.loads(line) # Skip queue operations and summaries for now if entry.get('type') in ['queue-operation']: continue # Handle summary entries if entry.get('type') == 'summary': messages.append({ 'role': 'summary', 'content': entry.get('summary', ''), 'timestamp': None }) continue # Handle regular messages if 'message' in entry: msg = entry['message'] role = msg.get('role', entry.get('type', 'unknown')) content, tool_calls = extract_content_parts(msg.get('content', '')) timestamp = entry.get('timestamp') messages.append({ 'role': role, 'content': content, 'tool_calls': tool_calls, 'timestamp': timestamp, 'error': entry.get('error'), 'uuid': entry.get('uuid') }) except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f"Warning: Failed to parse line in {file_path}: {e}") continue return messages def generate_chatlog_html(session_id, session_name, messages, github_url): """Generate HTML page for a chatlog.""" source_url = f"{github_url}/blob/main/docs/outputs/{session_id}.jsonl" html = f''' {escape(session_name)} - ClankerOS

ClankerOS

{escape(session_name)}

← Back to chatlogs | View source on GitHub

''' for msg in messages: role = msg['role'] content = msg['content'] tool_calls = msg.get('tool_calls', []) timestamp = msg.get('timestamp') error = msg.get('error') role_class = role.replace('_', '-') role_display = role.replace('_', ' ').title() html += f'
\n' html += f'
\n' html += f' {escape(role_display)}\n' if timestamp: html += f' {escape(format_timestamp(timestamp))}\n' html += f'
\n' if content: html += f'

ClankerOS

Chatlogs

    ''' for chatlog in sorted(chatlogs, key=lambda x: x['name']): name = chatlog['name'] session_id = chatlog['id'] message_count = chatlog['message_count'] html += f'''
  • {escape(name)} ({message_count} messages)

''' return html def generate_sessions_index(session_files): """Generate index page for session summaries.""" html = ''' Sessions - ClankerOS

    ''' for session_file in sorted(session_files): # Read first few lines to extract title with open(SESSIONS_DIR / session_file, 'r') as f: title = f.readline().strip('# \n') html += f'''
  • {escape(title)}
    • ''' html += '''
''' return html def main(): """Main function to generate website.""" print("Generating ClankerOS website...") # Get GitHub URL github_url = get_github_url() print(f"GitHub URL: {github_url}") # Create output directories chatlogs_dir = WEBSITE_DIR / 'chatlogs' sessions_web_dir = WEBSITE_DIR / 'sessions' chatlogs_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) sessions_web_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) # Update homepage with GitHub URL homepage = WEBSITE_DIR / 'index.html' if homepage.exists(): content = homepage.read_text() content = content.replace( 'https://github.com/yourusername/clankeros', github_url ) homepage.write_text(content) # Process JSONL chatlogs print("\nProcessing chatlogs...") chatlogs = [] for jsonl_file in OUTPUTS_DIR.glob('*.jsonl'): # Skip empty files if jsonl_file.stat().st_size == 0: continue session_id = jsonl_file.stem # Skip agent files for now if session_id.startswith('agent-'): continue print(f" Processing {session_id}...") messages = parse_jsonl(jsonl_file) if not messages: print(f" Skipped (no messages)") continue # Use first user message as session name, or default session_name = f"Session {session_id[:8]}" for msg in messages: if msg['role'] == 'user' and msg['content']: # Use first line of first user message first_line = msg['content'].split('\n')[0][:100] if first_line: session_name = first_line break # Generate HTML html = generate_chatlog_html(session_id, session_name, messages, github_url) output_file = chatlogs_dir / f"{session_id}.html" output_file.write_text(html) chatlogs.append({ 'id': session_id, 'name': session_name, 'message_count': len(messages) }) print(f" Generated {output_file.name} ({len(messages)} messages)") # Generate chatlog index if chatlogs: print("\nGenerating chatlog index...") chatlog_index = generate_chatlog_index(chatlogs) (WEBSITE_DIR / 'chatlogs.html').write_text(chatlog_index) # Process session summaries (convert markdown to HTML later) # For now, just create an index print("\nProcessing session summaries...") session_files = list(SESSIONS_DIR.glob('*.md')) if session_files: sessions_index = generate_sessions_index([f.name for f in session_files]) (WEBSITE_DIR / 'sessions.html').write_text(sessions_index) print(f"\n✓ Website generated in {WEBSITE_DIR}") print(f" - {len(chatlogs)} chatlogs") print(f" - {len(session_files)} session summaries") if __name__ == '__main__': main()

Perfect! Notice the message counts have decreased significantly:
- First chatlog: 147 → 87 messages (60 empty messages filtered out)
- Third chatlog: 1516 → 921 messages (595 empty messages filtered out)

The script now filters out user messages that contain only IDE notifications or system reminders with no actual content, making the chatlogs much cleaner and more readable.

#!/usr/bin/env python3 """ Generate static website for ClankerOS documentation. Converts JSONL chatlogs to readable HTML pages. """ import json import os import subprocess from pathlib import Path from datetime import datetime from html import escape # Project root PROJECT_ROOT = Path(__file__).parent.parent DOCS_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'docs' WEBSITE_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'website' OUTPUTS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'outputs' SESSIONS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'sessions' def get_github_url(): """Get GitHub repository URL from git remote.""" try: result = subprocess.run( ['git', 'remote', 'get-url', 'origin'], cwd=PROJECT_ROOT, capture_output=True, text=True, check=True ) url = result.stdout.strip() # Convert SSH URL to HTTPS if url.startswith('git@github.com:'): url = url.replace('git@github.com:', 'https://github.com/') if url.endswith('.git'): url = url[:-4] return url except: return 'https://github.com/yourusername/clankeros' def extract_content_parts(content): """Extract text and tool calls from message content.""" text_parts = [] tool_calls = [] if isinstance(content, str): return content, [] elif isinstance(content, list): for item in content: if isinstance(item, dict): if item.get('type') == 'text': text = item.get('text', '') # Skip IDE notification blocks if not text.startswith('') and not text.startswith(''): text_parts.append(text) elif item.get('type') == 'tool_use': tool_calls.append({ 'name': item.get('name', 'unknown'), 'input': item.get('input', {}), 'id': item.get('id', '') }) elif isinstance(item, str): text_parts.append(item) return '\n'.join(text_parts), tool_calls return '', [] def format_timestamp(timestamp_str): """Format ISO timestamp to human-readable format.""" try: dt = datetime.fromisoformat(timestamp_str.replace('Z', '+00:00')) return dt.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') except: return timestamp_str def parse_jsonl(file_path): """Parse JSONL file and extract messages.""" messages = [] with open(file_path, 'r') as f: for line in f: line = line.strip() if not line: continue try: entry = json.loads(line) # Skip queue operations and summaries for now if entry.get('type') in ['queue-operation']: continue # Handle summary entries if entry.get('type') == 'summary': messages.append({ 'role': 'summary', 'content': entry.get('summary', ''), 'timestamp': None }) continue # Handle regular messages if 'message' in entry: msg = entry['message'] role = msg.get('role', entry.get('type', 'unknown')) content, tool_calls = extract_content_parts(msg.get('content', '')) timestamp = entry.get('timestamp') # Skip messages with no content and no tool calls (e.g., only IDE notifications) if not content and not tool_calls: continue messages.append({ 'role': role, 'content': content, 'tool_calls': tool_calls, 'timestamp': timestamp, 'error': entry.get('error'), 'uuid': entry.get('uuid') }) except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f"Warning: Failed to parse line in {file_path}: {e}") continue return messages def generate_chatlog_html(session_id, session_name, messages, github_url): """Generate HTML page for a chatlog.""" source_url = f"{github_url}/blob/main/docs/outputs/{session_id}.jsonl" html = f''' {escape(session_name)} - ClankerOS

ClankerOS

{escape(session_name)}

← Back to chatlogs | View source on GitHub

''' for msg in messages: role = msg['role'] content = msg['content'] tool_calls = msg.get('tool_calls', []) timestamp = msg.get('timestamp') error = msg.get('error') role_class = role.replace('_', '-') role_display = role.replace('_', ' ').title() html += f'
\n' html += f'
\n' html += f' {escape(role_display)}\n' if timestamp: html += f' {escape(format_timestamp(timestamp))}\n' html += f'
\n' if content: html += f'
{escape(content)}
\n' # Add tool calls as collapsible sections for tool_call in tool_calls: tool_name = tool_call['name'] tool_input = tool_call['input'] # Format common tools nicely if tool_name == 'Bash': command = tool_input.get('command', '') desc = tool_input.get('description', '') content = tool_input.get('content', '') html += f'
\n' html += f' \n' html += f' ⚙️\n' html += f' {escape(command)}\n' if desc: html += f' {escape(desc)}\n' html += f' \n' if content: html += f' 
{escape(content)}
\n' html += f'

\n' html += f' \n' html += f' 📝\n' html += f' Writing to {escape(file_path)}\n' html += f' \n' if content: html += f' 
{escape(content)}
\n' html += f'

{status_icon} {escape(content)} ({status})

\n' html += f' 🔍\n' html += f' Searching for: {escape(pattern)}\n' html += f'
\n' else: # For other tools, show the full JSON in a collapsible section tool_input_json = json.dumps(tool_input, indent=2) html += f'
\n' html += f' Tool: {escape(tool_name)}\n' html += f' 
{escape(tool_input_json)}
\n' html += f'
\n' if error: html += f'
Error: {escape(error)}
\n' html += f'
\n' html += '''
''' return html def generate_chatlog_index(chatlogs): """Generate index page for chatlogs.""" html = ''' Chatlogs - ClankerOS

ClankerOS

Chatlogs

    ''' for chatlog in sorted(chatlogs, key=lambda x: x['name']): name = chatlog['name'] session_id = chatlog['id'] message_count = chatlog['message_count'] html += f'''
  • {escape(name)} ({message_count} messages)
    • ''' html += '''
''' return html def generate_sessions_index(session_files): """Generate index page for session summaries.""" html = ''' Sessions - ClankerOS

ClankerOS

Sessions

    ''' for session_file in sorted(session_files): # Read first few lines to extract title with open(SESSIONS_DIR / session_file, 'r') as f: title = f.readline().strip('# \n') html += f'''
  • {escape(title)}

''' return html def main(): """Main function to generate website.""" print("Generating ClankerOS website...") # Get GitHub URL github_url = get_github_url() print(f"GitHub URL: {github_url}") # Create output directories chatlogs_dir = WEBSITE_DIR / 'chatlogs' sessions_web_dir = WEBSITE_DIR / 'sessions' chatlogs_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) sessions_web_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) # Update homepage with GitHub URL homepage = WEBSITE_DIR / 'index.html' if homepage.exists(): content = homepage.read_text() content = content.replace( 'https://github.com/yourusername/clankeros', github_url ) homepage.write_text(content) # Process JSONL chatlogs print("\nProcessing chatlogs...") chatlogs = [] for jsonl_file in OUTPUTS_DIR.glob('*.jsonl'): # Skip empty files if jsonl_file.stat().st_size == 0: continue session_id = jsonl_file.stem # Skip agent files for now if session_id.startswith('agent-'): continue print(f" Processing {session_id}...") messages = parse_jsonl(jsonl_file) if not messages: print(f" Skipped (no messages)") continue # Use first user message as session name, or default session_name = f"Session {session_id[:8]}" for msg in messages: if msg['role'] == 'user' and msg['content']: # Use first line of first user message first_line = msg['content'].split('\n')[0][:100] if first_line: session_name = first_line break # Generate HTML html = generate_chatlog_html(session_id, session_name, messages, github_url) output_file = chatlogs_dir / f"{session_id}.html" output_file.write_text(html) chatlogs.append({ 'id': session_id, 'name': session_name, 'message_count': len(messages) }) print(f" Generated {output_file.name} ({len(messages)} messages)") # Generate chatlog index if chatlogs: print("\nGenerating chatlog index...") chatlog_index = generate_chatlog_index(chatlogs) (WEBSITE_DIR / 'chatlogs.html').write_text(chatlog_index) # Process session summaries (convert markdown to HTML later) # For now, just create an index print("\nProcessing session summaries...") session_files = list(SESSIONS_DIR.glob('*.md')) if session_files: sessions_index = generate_sessions_index([f.name for f in session_files]) (WEBSITE_DIR / 'sessions.html').write_text(sessions_index) print(f"\n✓ Website generated in {WEBSITE_DIR}") print(f" - {len(chatlogs)} chatlogs") print(f" - {len(session_files)} session summaries") if __name__ == '__main__': main()

Perfect! Now the todo lists will display as proper HTML checkboxes with:
- ✓ Checked boxes for completed items (with strikethrough text)
- □ Unchecked boxes for pending and in-progress items
- Color-coded status badges:
  - Green for "completed"
  - Blue for "in progress"

This gives a much cleaner, more familiar interface for viewing the task lists.

#!/usr/bin/env python3 """ Generate static website for ClankerOS documentation. Converts JSONL chatlogs to readable HTML pages. """ import json import os import subprocess from pathlib import Path from datetime import datetime from html import escape # Project root PROJECT_ROOT = Path(__file__).parent.parent DOCS_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'docs' WEBSITE_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'website' OUTPUTS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'outputs' SESSIONS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'sessions' def get_github_url(): """Get GitHub repository URL from git remote.""" try: result = subprocess.run( ['git', 'remote', 'get-url', 'origin'], cwd=PROJECT_ROOT, capture_output=True, text=True, check=True ) url = result.stdout.strip() # Convert SSH URL to HTTPS if url.startswith('git@github.com:'): url = url.replace('git@github.com:', 'https://github.com/') if url.endswith('.git'): url = url[:-4] return url except: return 'https://github.com/yourusername/clankeros' def extract_content_parts(content): """Extract text and tool calls from message content.""" text_parts = [] tool_calls = [] if isinstance(content, str): return content, [] elif isinstance(content, list): for item in content: if isinstance(item, dict): if item.get('type') == 'text': text = item.get('text', '') # Skip IDE notification blocks if not text.startswith('') and not text.startswith(''): text_parts.append(text) elif item.get('type') == 'tool_use': tool_calls.append({ 'name': item.get('name', 'unknown'), 'input': item.get('input', {}), 'id': item.get('id', '') }) elif isinstance(item, str): text_parts.append(item) return '\n'.join(text_parts), tool_calls return '', [] def format_timestamp(timestamp_str): """Format ISO timestamp to human-readable format.""" try: dt = datetime.fromisoformat(timestamp_str.replace('Z', '+00:00')) return dt.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') except: return timestamp_str def parse_jsonl(file_path): """Parse JSONL file and extract messages.""" messages = [] with open(file_path, 'r') as f: for line in f: line = line.strip() if not line: continue try: entry = json.loads(line) # Skip queue operations and summaries for now if entry.get('type') in ['queue-operation']: continue # Handle summary entries if entry.get('type') == 'summary': messages.append({ 'role': 'summary', 'content': entry.get('summary', ''), 'timestamp': None }) continue # Handle regular messages if 'message' in entry: msg = entry['message'] role = msg.get('role', entry.get('type', 'unknown')) content, tool_calls = extract_content_parts(msg.get('content', '')) timestamp = entry.get('timestamp') # Skip messages with no content and no tool calls (e.g., only IDE notifications) if not content and not tool_calls: continue messages.append({ 'role': role, 'content': content, 'tool_calls': tool_calls, 'timestamp': timestamp, 'error': entry.get('error'), 'uuid': entry.get('uuid') }) except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f"Warning: Failed to parse line in {file_path}: {e}") continue return messages def generate_chatlog_html(session_id, session_name, messages, github_url): """Generate HTML page for a chatlog.""" source_url = f"{github_url}/blob/main/docs/outputs/{session_id}.jsonl" html = f''' {escape(session_name)} - ClankerOS

Use first user message as session name, or default session_name = f"Session {session_id[:8]}" for msg in messages: if msg['role'] == 'user' and msg['content']: # Use first line of first user message first_line = msg['content'].split('\n')[0][:100] if first_line: session_name = first_line break # Generate chatlog index if chatlogs: print("\nGenerating chatlog index...") chatlog_index = generate_chatlog_index(chatlogs) (WEBSITE_DIR / 'chatlogs.html').write_text(chatlog_index) # Process session summaries (convert markdown to HTML later) # """ import json import os import subprocess from pathlib import Path from datetime import datetime from html import escape # Project root PROJECT_ROOT = Path(__file__).parent.parent DOCS_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'docs' WEBSITE_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'website' OUTPUTS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'outputs' SESSIONS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'sessions' def get_github_url(): """Get GitHub repository URL from git remote.""" try: result = subprocess.run( ['git', 'remote', 'get-url', 'origin'], cwd=PROJECT_ROOT, capture_output=True, text=True, check=True ) url = result.stdout.strip() # Convert SSH URL to HTTPS if url.startswith('git@github.com:'): url = url.replace('git@github.com:', 'https://github.com/') if url.endswith('.git'): url = url[:-4] return url except: return 'https://github.com/yourusername/clankeros' def extract_content_parts(content): """Extract text and tool calls from message content.""" text_parts = [] tool_calls = [] if isinstance(content, str): return content, [] elif isinstance(content, list): for item in content: if isinstance(item, dict): if item.get('type') == 'text': text = item.get('text', '') # Skip IDE notification blocks if not text.startswith('') and not text.startswith(''): text_parts.append(text) elif item.get('type') == 'tool_use': tool_calls.append({ 'name': item.get('name', 'unknown'), 'input': item.get('input', {}), 'id': item.get('id', '') }) elif isinstance(item, str): text_parts.append(item) return '\n'.join(text_parts), tool_calls return '', [] def format_timestamp(timestamp_str): """Format ISO timestamp to human-readable format.""" try: dt = datetime.fromisoformat(timestamp_str.replace('Z', '+00:00')) return dt.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') except: return timestamp_str def parse_jsonl(file_path): """Parse JSONL file and extract messages.""" messages = [] with open(file_path, 'r') as f: for line in f: line = line.strip() if not line: continue try: entry = json.loads(line) # Skip queue operations and summaries for now if entry.get('type') in ['queue-operation']: continue # Handle summary entries if entry.get('type') == 'summary': messages.append({ 'role': 'summary', 'content': entry.get('summary', ''), 'timestamp': None }) continue # Handle regular messages if 'message' in entry: msg = entry['message'] role = msg.get('role', entry.get('type', 'unknown')) content_parts = msg.get('content', '') content, tool_calls = extract_content_parts(content_parts) timestamp = entry.get('timestamp') # Check for tool results in the message tool_results = {} if isinstance(content_parts, list): for item in content_parts: if isinstance(item, dict) and item.get('type') == 'tool_result': tool_use_id = item.get('tool_use_id') result_content = item.get('content', '') # Also check for toolUseResult field in the entry if 'toolUseResult' in entry: result_data = entry['toolUseResult'] if 'stdout' in result_data or 'stderr' in result_data: # Bash output result_content = result_data.get('stdout', '') or result_data.get('stderr', '') tool_results[tool_use_id] = result_content # Skip messages with no content and no tool calls (e.g., only IDE notifications) if not content and not tool_calls and not tool_results: continue messages.append({ 'role': role, 'content': content, 'tool_calls': tool_calls, 'tool_results': tool_results, 'timestamp': timestamp, 'error': entry.get('error'), 'uuid': entry.get('uuid') }) except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f"Warning: Failed to parse line in {file_path}: {e}") continue return messages def generate_chatlog_html(session_id, session_name, messages, github_url): """Generate HTML page for a chatlog.""" source_url = f"{github_url}/blob/main/docs/outputs/{session_id}.jsonl" html = f''' {escape(session_name)} - ClankerOS

#!/usr/bin/env python3 """ Generate static website for ClankerOS documentation. Converts JSONL chatlogs to readable HTML pages. """ import json import os import subprocess from pathlib import Path from datetime import datetime from html import escape # Project root PROJECT_ROOT = Path(__file__).parent.parent DOCS_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'docs' WEBSITE_DIR = PROJECT_ROOT / 'website' OUTPUTS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'outputs' SESSIONS_DIR = DOCS_DIR / 'sessions' def get_github_url(): """Get GitHub repository URL from git remote.""" try: result = subprocess.run( ['git', 'remote', 'get-url', 'origin'], cwd=PROJECT_ROOT, capture_output=True, text=True, check=True ) url = result.stdout.strip() # Convert SSH URL to HTTPS if url.startswith('git@github.com:'): url = url.replace('git@github.com:', 'https://github.com/') if url.endswith('.git'): url = url[:-4] return url except: return 'https://github.com/yourusername/clankeros' def extract_content_parts(content): """Extract text and tool calls from message content.""" text_parts = [] tool_calls = [] if isinstance(content, str): return content, [] elif isinstance(content, list): for item in content: if isinstance(item, dict): if item.get('type') == 'text': text = item.get('text', '') # Skip IDE notification blocks if not text.startswith('') and not text.startswith(''): text_parts.append(text) elif item.get('type') == 'tool_use': tool_calls.append({ 'name': item.get('name', 'unknown'), 'input': item.get('input', {}), 'id': item.get('id', '') }) elif isinstance(item, str): text_parts.append(item) return '\n'.join(text_parts), tool_calls return '', [] def format_timestamp(timestamp_str): """Format ISO timestamp to human-readable format.""" try: dt = datetime.fromisoformat(timestamp_str.replace('Z', '+00:00')) return dt.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') except: return timestamp_str def parse_jsonl(file_path): """Parse JSONL file and extract messages.""" messages = [] with open(file_path, 'r') as f: for line in f: line = line.strip() if not line: continue try: entry = json.loads(line) # Skip queue operations and summaries for now if entry.get('type') in ['queue-operation']: continue # Handle summary entries if entry.get('type') == 'summary': messages.append({ 'role': 'summary', 'content': entry.get('summary', ''), 'timestamp': None }) continue # Handle regular messages if 'message' in entry: msg = entry['message'] role = msg.get('role', entry.get('type', 'unknown')) content_parts = msg.get('content', '') content, tool_calls = extract_content_parts(content_parts) timestamp = entry.get('timestamp') # Check for tool results in the message tool_results = {} if isinstance(content_parts, list): for item in content_parts: if isinstance(item, dict) and item.get('type') == 'tool_result': tool_use_id = item.get('tool_use_id') result_content = item.get('content', '') # Also check for toolUseResult field in the entry if 'toolUseResult' in entry: result_data = entry['toolUseResult'] if 'stdout' in result_data or 'stderr' in result_data: # Bash output result_content = result_data.get('stdout', '') or result_data.get('stderr', '') tool_results[tool_use_id] = result_content # Skip messages with no content and no tool calls (e.g., only IDE notifications) if not content and not tool_calls and not tool_results: continue messages.append({ 'role': role, 'content': content, 'tool_calls': tool_calls, 'tool_results': tool_results, 'timestamp': timestamp, 'error': entry.get('error'), 'uuid': entry.get('uuid') }) except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f"Warning: Failed to parse line in {file_path}: {e}") continue return messages def generate_chatlog_html(session_id, session_name, messages, github_url): """Generate HTML page for a chatlog.""" source_url = f"{github_url}/blob/main/docs/outputs/{session_id}.jsonl" # Perfect! The website has been regenerated with Bash output support. Now:

1. ✅ User prompts are visible (filtered out IDE/system-reminder blocks)
2. ✅ Empty messages filtered out (those with only IDE notifications)
3. ✅ Todo lists display with HTML checkboxes and status colors
4. ✅ **Bash commands now show their output** in collapsible sections

The refactor successfully:
- Builds a map of all tool results at the start
- Skips displaying user messages that only contain tool results (since they're shown with the tool call)
- Looks up and displays the result for each Bash command in the collapsible details

The chatlogs should now be much more complete and useful for understanding what happened during each session!

This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The conversation is summarized below: Analysis: Let me chronologically analyze this conversation about building a documentation website for ClankerOS: **Initial Context:** - This is a continuation from a previous conversation (summary was provided at start) - The website generation was already functional with tool call display - User identified several issues that needed fixing **Most Recent Work (Current Session):** 1. **User pointed out missing user prompts** - "A lot of the user prompts have disappeared" - I identified that `` and `` blocks were being included - Fixed by filtering them out in `extract_content_parts()` function - Added logic to skip these blocks starting with those tags 2. **User requested filtering empty messages** - "Can you filter user prompts without any text" - Added check to skip messages with no content AND no tool calls AND no tool results - This removed messages that only contained IDE notifications 3. **User requested todo list improvements** - "The todo list updates don't include the todos" - Changed from inline display to `
` element with checkbox list - Added HTML checkboxes with checked/disabled states - Added color-coded status badges (green/blue/gray) - Added strikethrough for completed items 4. **User requested HTML checkboxes for todos** - "Can you use an HTML list with checkboxes?" - Implemented proper HTML checkbox list with proper styling - Used disabled checkboxes (non-interactive) - Added visual status indicators 5. **User identified missing Bash outputs** - "The bash output is also missing from the page" - This was the most complex issue - Tool results are stored in separate user messages, not in the tool call itself - Required refactoring to: - Build a map of tool_use_id → result from all messages - Match tool calls to their results - Display results with the tool call - Skip user messages that only contain tool results 6. **User's most recent request** - "Before we check this in. Can you add Markdown support with an established library as opposed to using your generated code? Let me know which one to use, add it to the action workflow, and I will install it on this system." This is asking to replace the custom markdown parser in `scripts/convert_markdown.py` with an established library. **Key Technical Details:** - JSONL format has tool_use in assistant messages with an ID - Tool results come in subsequent user messages with tool_use_id matching - The toolUseResult field contains stdout/stderr for Bash commands - Messages can have multiple content blocks of different types **Files Modified:** - `scripts/generate_website.py` - Multiple iterations of improvements - `website/css/style.css` - Styling for todo lists and tool calls - No changes to `scripts/convert_markdown.py` yet (pending task) **Current State:** - Website generation works well with all requested features - Custom markdown parser in `scripts/convert_markdown.py` needs to be replaced - User wants recommendation for markdown library and workflow update Summary: 1. **Primary Request and Intent:** -
